Center of viewport on map (alternative to center)
Center of viewport on map (alternative to center)
Scale = Math.pow(2,zoom) on map (alternative to opt.scale)
Camera angle in degrees (0 is straight down)
Map rotation in degrees (0 means north is up)
Altitude of camera in screen units
Altitude has a default value that matches assumptions in mapbox-gl

are forced to 1 if supplied as 0, to avoid

When using mercatorProjection, per cartographic tradition, longitudes and
latitudes are specified as degrees.
Projects latitude and longitude to pixel coordinates on screen.
projected coords are top left, otherwise bottom left

By default, returns top-left coordinates suitable for canvas/SVG type
rendering.
Unproject pixel coordinates on screen to longitude and latitude on map.
projected coords are top left, otherwise bottom left
Project longitude and latitude onto Web Mercator coordinates.

Unprojects a Web Mercator coordinate to longitude and latitude.
| Parameter      | Type      | Default  | Description                     |
| -------------- | --------- | -------- | ------------------------------- |

Get a new flat viewport that fits around the given bounding box.

([[Number,Number],[Number,Number]]) - an array of two opposite corners of
the bounding box. Each corner is specified in

(Number|{top:Number, bottom: Number, left: Number, right: Number}, optional) - The amount of
padding in pixels to add to the given bounds from the edge of the viewport. If padding is set as object, all parameters are
required.
([Number,Number], optional) - The center of the given bounds relative to the viewport's center,
Returns the map center that place a given [lng, lat] coordinate at screen point [x, y].
(Array, required) - [lng,lat] coordinates of a location on the sphere.
(Array, required) - [x,y] coordinates of a pixel on screen.
